item.title: Syrians Mourn All They Have Lost, Even as They Celebrate
item.description: Thoughts of loved ones dead or missing complicate joyous relief at the prospect of an end to the rule of Bashar al-Assad.

item.title: Which Marco Rubio Will Serve President Trump?
item.description: Rubio, the choice for secretary of state, has evolved from a hawkish optimist to a more inward-looking, antiglobalist pessimist.

item.title: Miho Nakayama, Japanese Music and Movie Star, Dies at 54
item.description: A top-selling pop singer as a teenager in the 1980s, she also had an award-winning career as a dramatic actress.

item.title: She Sued Over Transgender ‘Conversion Therapy,’ a First for China
item.description: Ling’er won a settlement payout from the hospital where she was held for three months against her will and subjected to electroshock therapy.

item.title: South Korea’s Ex-Defense Chief Is Detained Over Martial Law Episode
item.description: Prosecutors are investigating whether President Yoon Suk Yeol and his followers committed insurrection when they briefly put South Korea under martial...
